I've got a Dell that apparently won't play with lm_sensors...
so you got to find the correct modules youself then, Im sure for cpu temp least there are somes
if this thing runs for an hour without shutting down, I'm going to call it good and blame it on dust in the fan/radiator assembly
you could stress the cpu some time, then reboot in bios and look for temp, quick n dirty
what's the best way to do that?
spills an url of your fstab to look at here
It's really only this: UUID=accc748f-6a4b-4fba-b40f-2c62406a692e that's throwing me for a loop.  Back when I was a wee lad, I used to just put in something that looked like /dev/sdc1
do I even want to know the rationale?  Is this something legit, or another one of those "buttons on the left" things.  ;)
that strings nowadays stand for the old /dev/whatever
it is, as a unique identifier is found, even if you swap drives,  a /dev/.. won't do it there
so this: UUID="4A80FF4380FF3453" /bigdrive       ntfs    errors=remount-ro 0       1                 should work?
yess, but don't forget the options (aka user,exe or desired)
